title: Tracking issue for conflicting `repr(...)` hints future compatibility

labels.name: A-lint
labels.description: Area: Lints (warnings about flaws in source code) such as unused_mut.

body:
This is the **summary issue** for a bug fix related to `repr(...)` hints. The goal of this page is describe why this change was made and how you can fix code that is affected by it. It also provides a place to ask questions or register a complaint if you feel the change should not be made. For more information on the policy around future-compatibility warnings, see our [breaking change policy guidelines][guidelines].

[guidelines]: https://forge.rust-lang.org/rustc-bug-fix-procedure.html

### What is the warning for?

The compiler incorrectly accepts `#[repr(...)]` hints on data types where the hints are incompatible and have conflicts. Examples of this includes:

```rust
// from `src/test/ui/conflicting-repr-hints.rs

#[repr(u32, u64)] //~ ERROR conflicting representation hints
enum D {
    D,
}
```

We are presently issuing a deny-by-default lint when conflicting representation hints are used together but we expect to transition the lint to hard **errors** in the future.

### How can you fix your code?

Generally speaking, the conflict should be fixed by more clearly expressing your intent so that the conflict is resolved.
